alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:31PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Pine, southeastern St. Louis, eastern Carlton and northwestern Douglas Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 631 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Wisconsin Point, to 9 miles northwest of Cloverton, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Superior, Wisconsin Point and South Range around 635 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Hawthorne. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Minnesota.
